content.content:
The following resources are found in the PatientAider and below:

## Airways & Ventilators

[Hospital-acquired Pneumonia Information from the National Library of Medicine](https://www.nlm.nih.gov/medlineplus/ency/article/000146.htm)

[Mechanical Ventilation Information from the American Thoracic Society](https://www.thoracic.org/patients/patient-resources/resources/mechanical-ventilation.pdf)

[Tracheostomy in Adults Information from the American Thoracic Society](https://www.thoracic.org/patients/patient-resources/resources/tracheostomy-in-adults-1.pdf)

[What to Expect While on a Ventilator from the National Heart, Lung, & Blood Institute](https://www.nhlbi.nih.gov/health/health-topics/topics/vent/while)

## Anemia & Blood Transfusion

[Anemia from MedlinePlus](https://medlineplus.gov/ency/article/000560.htm)

[Anemia Patient Information from the Society of Hematology](http://www.hematology.org/Patients/Anemia/)

[Blood Transfusion and Donation from MedlinePlus](https://medlineplus.gov/bloodtransfusionanddonation.html)

[Alternatives to Blood Transfusions from the American Cancer Society](https://www.cancer.org/treatment/treatments-and-side-effects/treatment-types/blood-transfusion-and-donation/blood-transfusion-alternatives.html)

[What are the Risks of a Blood Transfusion? from the National Heart, Lung, & Blood Institute
](https://www.nhlbi.nih.gov/health-topics/blood-transfusion#risk-factors)

## Before the Hospital
[Safe Patient Guides from the Safe Care Campaign
](https://safecarecampaign.org/for-patients.html)

[How to Choose the Best Hospital for Surgery from the National Library of Medicine](https://medlineplus.gov/ency/article/007497.htm)

[10 Things To Know For Surgery from the Empowered Patient](http://patientsafetymovement.org/wp-content/uploads/2016/02/Resources_Checklist_Ten_Things_To_Know_For_Surgery.pdf)

[Emergency Room Fact Sheet from the Empowered Patient Coalition and Leah's Legacy](http://patientsafetymovement.org/wp-content/uploads/2017/02/emergency_room_fact_sheet.pdf)

[Blood Tests When You're in the Hospital from Choosing Wisely by the American Board of Internal Medicine (ABIM)](http://www.choosingwisely.org/patient-resources/blood-tests-when-youre-in-the-hospital/)

[Your Hospital Survival Guide from Consumer Reports](http://www.consumerreports.org/cro/2012/10/your-hospital-survival-guide/index.htm)

[Checklist for Getting the Right Diagnosis from the National Patient Safety Foundation
](https://cdn.ymaws.com/www.npsf.org/resource/collection/930A0426-5BAC-4827-AF94-1CE1624CBE67/Checklist-for-Getting-the-Right-Diagnosis.pdf)

 __Use the Hospital Plan of Care form to advocate and ask questions about your loved one.__

[The Hospital Plan of Care form](https://patientsafetymovement.org/wp-content/uploads/2020/07/POC-Blank-April-19.pdf "The Hospital Plan of Care form")

[Guide to Medical Care at a Distance](https://patientsafetymovement.org/wp-content/uploads/2020/07/Guide-to-Medical-Care-at-a-Distance.pdf "Guide to Medical Care at a Distance")

[Deep Vein Thrombosis Information from the National Library of Medicine](https://www.nlm.nih.gov/medlineplus/deepveinthrombosis.html)

[Blood Clot information from the National Blood Clot Alliance](https://www.stoptheclot.org/spreadtheword/wp-content/uploads/2015/12/NBCA-Infographic.pdf)

[Acute Blood Clots from Choosing Wisely by the American Board of Internal Medicine (ABIM)](http://www.choosingwisely.org/patient-resources/acute-blood-clots/)

[VTE information from the World Thrombosis Day](http://www.worldthrombosisday.org/issue/vte/)

## Caregiver Support

[The Family Caregiver Alliance](https://www.caregiver.org)

[Helpguide Caregiving Support and Help](https://www.helpguide.org/articles/caregiving/caregiving-support-and-help.htm)

## Communication

[Who's Who in the Hospital from the Empowered Patient Coalition](http://patientsafetymovement.org/wp-content/uploads/2016/02/Resources_Forms_Whos_Who_in_the_Hospital.pdf)

[10 Questions You Should Know from the Agency for Healthcare and Research Quality](https://www.ahrq.gov/patients-consumers/patient-involvement/ask-your-doctor/10questions.html)

 __Use the Hospital Plan of Care form to advocate and ask questions about your loved one.__
[The Hospital Plan of Care form](https://patientsafetymovement.org/wp-content/uploads/2020/07/POC-Blank-April-19.pdf "The Hospital Plan of Care form")
[Guide to Medical Care at a Distance](https://patientsafetymovement.org/wp-content/uploads/2020/07/Guide-to-Medical-Care-at-a-Distance.pdf "Guide to Medical Care at a Distance")

[Top Ten Tips for Talking with your Doctor from LifeSpan](https://lifespanohio.org/talk-doctor/ "Top Ten Tips for Talking with your Doctor from LifeSpan")

## COVID-19

[What to do if you are sick from the CDC](https://www.cdc.gov/coronavirus/2019-ncov/if-you-are-sick/steps-when-sick.html)

[Guide to Medical Care at a Distance](https://patientsafetymovement.org/wp-content/uploads/2020/07/Guide-to-Medical-Care-at-a-Distance.pdf "Guide to Medical Care at a Distance")

 __Use the Hospital Plan of Care form to ask questions.__

[The Hospital Plan of Care form](https://patientsafetymovement.org/wp-content/uploads/2020/07/POC-Blank-April-19.pdf "The Hospital Plan of Care form")

[Advice for everyone from the NHS](https://www.nhs.uk/conditions/coronavirus-covid-19/)

[Mental Health and Coping Resource from the CDC](https://www.cdc.gov/coronavirus/2019-ncov/daily-life-coping/managing-stress-anxiety.html?CDC_AA_refVal=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.cdc.gov%2Fcoronavirus%2F2019-ncov%2Fprepare%2Fmanaging-stress-anxiety.html): 

[Information for Healthcare Professionals](https://www.cdc.gov/coronavirus/2019-nCoV/hcp/index.html)

[Basic Protective Measures from the World Health Organization](https://www.who.int/emergencies/diseases/novel-coronavirus-2019/advice-for-public)

[Hand Washing Guidelines from the CDC](https://www.cdc.gov/handwashing/when-how-handwashing.html)

## Critical Congenital Heart Disease (CCHD)

[5 Things You Need to Know About Congenital Heart Disease from the CDC](https://www.cdc.gov/ncbddd/heartdefects/documents/5ThingsCHD.pdf)

[Screening for Critical Congenital Heart Disease from the CDC](https://www.cdc.gov/ncbddd/heartdefects/documents/ncbddd_birth-defects_cchd-newborn-screening.pdf)

[Newborn Screening Information from Baby's First Test](http://www.babysfirsttest.org)

[Tips to Survive Your Child's Hospital Stay from Parents.com](http://www.parents.com/parenting/better-parenting/advice/tips-to-survive-your-childs-hospital-stay/)

## Medication Information

[Medication Errors by the National Library of Medicine](https://www.nlm.nih.gov/medlineplus/medicationerrors.html)

[Opioid Fact Sheet from the Empowered Patient Coalition](http://patientsafetymovement.org/wp-content/uploads/2017/02/ten-things-opioid-fact-sheet.pdf)

[Antibiotic Treatment in the Hospital from Choosing Wisely by the American Board of Internal Medicine (ABIM)](http://www.choosingwisely.org/patient-resources/antibiotic-treatment-in-the-hospital/)

[Antibiotics for People with Catheters from Choosing Wisely by the American Board of Internal Medicine (ABIM)
](http://www.choosingwisely.org/patient-resources/antibiotics-for-people-with-catheters/)

[Hospital Medication Safety Information by the National Library of Medicine](https://www.nlm.nih.gov/medlineplus/ency/patientinstructions/000501.htm)

[Medication Error Prevention from the Institute for Safe Medication Practices](http://www.consumermedsafety.org)

[Drug Reaction Information from the National Library of Medicine](https://www.nlm.nih.gov/medlineplus/drugreactions.html)

[Drugs, Herbs and Supplement Information from the National Library of Medicine](https://www.nlm.nih.gov/medlineplus/druginformation.html)

[Consumer Reports Best Buy Drugs](http://www.consumerreports.org/cro/health/prescription-drugs/best-buy-drugs/index.htm)

[Safe Injection Practices from the CDC](http://www.oneandonlycampaign.org)

[Hospitalization Happens: A Guide to Hospital Visits for Individuals with Memory Loss by the National Institute on Aging](https://www.nia.nih.gov/alzheimers/publication/hospitalization-happens)

[Patient Safety Voices Advice from ProPublica](https://www.propublica.org/article/patient-safety-voices-advice)

[Your Hospital Survival Guide from Consumer Reports](http://www.consumerreports.org/cro/2012/10/your-hospital-survival-guide/index.htm)

## If Something Goes Wrong

[The Medicare Quality Improvement Organization for your state.](http://www.ahqa.org/quality-improvement-organizations/whats-next-for-qios)

[Click here to find your state's health services](https://healthfinder.gov/FindServices/SearchOrgType.aspx?OrgTypeID=8)

[The Joint Commission's Report a Patient Safety Event](https://www.jointcommission.org/report_a_complaint.aspx)

[Patient Safety Voices Advice from ProPublica](https://www.propublica.org/article/patient-safety-voices-advice)

## Stress Reduction

## Suicide

[National Suicide Prevention Lifeline](https://suicidepreventionlifeline.org): 1-800-273-TALK (8255), confidential help 24-hours-a-day or call 911.

[Veterans Crisis Line](https://www.veteranscrisisline.net): 1–800–273–8255,press 1

[Crisis Text Line](https://www.crisistextline.org): text START to 741–741

[SAMSHA National Helpline is confidential, free, 24 hour, 365 days treatment referral service (English & Spanish)](https://www.samhsa.gov/find-help/national-helpline): Treatment Referral Routing Service: 1–800–662–HELP (4357) from SAMSHA (Substance Abuse and Mental Health Services Administration)

[SAMSHA Behavioral Health Treatment Services Locator](https://findtreatment.samhsa.gov/ "https://findtreatment.samhsa.gov/")

[What To Do In a Crisis from NAMI](https://www.nami.org/Find-Support/Living-with-a-Mental-Health-Condition/What-to-Do-In-a-Crisis)

[How to Help in an Emotional Crisis from APA](http://www.apa.org/helpcenter/emotional-crisis.aspx)

[Risk of Suicide from NAMI](https://www.nami.org/Learn-More/Mental-Health-Conditions/Related-Conditions/Suicide)

[Veteran's Crisis Line from US Department of Veterans Affairs](https://www.veteranscrisisline.net)

[Suicide Prevention Resources for parents/guardians/families](http://www.sprc.org/sites/default/files/resource-program/Families.pdf)

[Suicide Prevention from Helpguide.org](https://www.helpguide.org/articles/suicide-prevention/suicide-prevention.htm#teens)
